gameMembers

Class Drawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameMembers.Drawable
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Alert, EnvironmentMember, HealthBar, Room

    public abstract class Drawable
extends java.lang.Object
    Anything that will be drawn to the screen needs to inherit Drawable so that all objects of this type can be drawn to the screen at the same time. Keep in mind that EnvironmentMember inherits this class so use that class if it's going to interact with the environment.

    Otherwise, use this class for generic uses that don't actually interact with anything, like UI elements.

    This class has an x and y so it can be drawn to the screen.

    Author:
    Hughes
    See Also:
    EnvironmentMember

    • Constructor Detail

      • Drawable

        public Drawable(float x,
                float y)
        Sets the initial x and y location of the object
        Parameters:
        x - the x location of the object in Cartesian space
        y - the y location of the object in Cartesian space

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        This method is required to be implemented by any class that inherits it. This allows draw to be called on a generic Drawable[].

        Implementation of this method should involve putting a graphical representation of the class on the screen in some way.

        An example of how to draw:

        g.drawImage(this.getImage());

        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object passed in from the class that has a draw method. This allows the object to draw itself
